content.title: Unoccupied dwellings census of 1st June 2009 – Further decrease in empty dwellings
content.lead: (FSO) - On 1 June 2009, approximately 34,760 dwellings, or 0.90% of the estimated total housing stock, were empty. On the reference day (1 June 2009), 34,760, or 0.90% of all dwellings, were registered as empty. Compared with the previous year, this meant that 2360 fewer dwellings were vacant, which represents a decrease of more than 6%. Among the major regions, only Zurich and Ticino showed an increase in empty dwellings and the vacancy rate. However, in all the other major regions, vacancies and the vacancy rate, fell further compared with the previous year. In eighteen cantons vacancies fell; in eight cantons they increased. The greatest vacancy rate decrease was registered in the canton of Appenzell Ausserrhoden (from 1.59% to 1.14%); the greatest increase was observed in the neighbouring canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden (from 1.01% to 1.30%). With 0.22%, the canton of Geneva continued to have the fewest empty dwellings in relation to its housing stock. The highest cantonal vacancy rates were registered in the cantons of Jura and Glarus, both with 1.89%.
